alert.note: Alert for Wilkes (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 06 at 6:49PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Flood Warning in Effect for the Reddies River and its tributaries near North Wilkesboro... ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall Sunday afternoon and evening. * WHERE...A portion of northwest North Carolina, including the following county, Wilkes. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 643 PM EDT, From 2 to 3 inches of rain fell late this afternoon and early evening across central Wilkes county, including the Wilkesboro area. This has result in a rapid rise on the Reddis River from only 1.5 feet earlier this afternoon to 7.3 feet as of 630 PM EDT this evening. Action state is 6.0 feeet. Local law enforcement personnel have reported that the river is near bankful and continuing to rise. Flooding of the river and its tributaries is imminent during the next few hours as a result of excessive runoff from the earlier heavy rainfall. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... North Wilkesboro, Wilkesboro, Wilbar, Millers Creek, Mulberry, Cricket and Fairplains. - For additional information, please go to our web page located at: http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Precautions: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
